intro: Lavandula stoechas f. macrostachya, commonly known as the Spanish lavender or the purple lavender, is a cultivar of the lavender plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and distinctive, pinecone-like flower spikes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is a compact, shrubby perennial that is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and aromatic properties. This variety is also valued for its use in aromatherapy and as a source of essential oils.
